__init__(memory_kernel_dict, chatbot, parent_kernel_label, child_kernel_label, system_prompt, clustering_method, path_group, task_id='MultiKernelTask', max_workers=1, calls_per_minute=20)[source]

Construct a new ‘BaseTask’ object.

Parameters:

  • path (List[List[int]]) – A list of lists containing the paths of sub-tasks.

  • max_workers (int) – The maximum number of worker threads to spawn (default is 1).

  • task_id (str) – A unique identifier for the task (default is “task”).

  • calls_per_minute (int) – The maximum number of calls that can be made per minute (default is 20).

  • backup (bool) – A flag to indicate whether to save results as backup or not (default is True).

  • save_path (str) – The path to save the results file.

  • memory_kernel_dict (Dict) –

  • chatbot (BaseChat) –

  • parent_kernel_label (str) –

  • child_kernel_label (str) –

  • system_prompt (str) –

  • path_group (Dict[str, List[List[int]]]) –

_execute_sub_task(sub_path)[source]

Execute a sub-task and return the results.

Parameters:

sub_path (List[int]) – A list containing the path of the sub-task.

Returns:

A list containing the results of the sub-task.

List[str]

execute_task()[source]

Execute the main task and handle errors.

The results are saved to a file if ‘self.backup’ is True.

Return type:

None
